meanings.definition: A person who writhes or twists in pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The writhers in the hospital moaned in agony.
meanings.sent2: The writhers in the waiting room clutched their stomachs in pain.
meanings.sent3: The writhers at the comedy show pretended to be in pain for a skit.
meanings.sent4: The writhers on the haunted house ride screamed in terror.
meanings.sent5: The writhers in the horror movie made the audience shiver with fear.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who are writhing or twisting in pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The writhers gathered in the field, each one contorting in agony.
meanings.sent2: The writhers in the support group shared their stories of pain and suffering.
meanings.sent3: The writhers at the dance class tried to follow the instructor's complicated moves.
meanings.sent4: The writhers in the haunted house attraction twisted and turned in fear.
meanings.sent5: The writhers in the horror novel painted a vivid picture of torment.
